intro: Elaeodendron anjouanense, commonly known as the Anjouan olive, is a small evergreen tree native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forest areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
